sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• Bile acid synthesis defect, Due to single enzyme defects: 10 to 15 mg/kg ORALLY once daily or in 2 divided doses with food; discontinue if liver function does not improve within 3 months or if complete biliary obstruction occurs
  • Disorder of peroxisomal function, With liver disease manifestations, steatorrhea, or complications due to decreased absorption of fat soluble vitamins: 10 to 15 mg/kg ORALLY once daily or in 2 divided doses with food; discontinue if liver function does not improve within 3 months or if complete biliary obstruction occurs

sub.title: Pediatric Dosing
sub.mono:
• Bile acid synthesis defect, Due to single enzyme defects: 3 weeks or older: 10 to 15 mg/kg ORALLY once daily or in 2 divided doses with food; discontinue if liver function does not improve within 3 months or if complete biliary obstruction occurs
  • Disorder of peroxisomal function, With liver disease manifestations, steatorrhea, or complications due to decreased absorption of fat soluble vitamins: 3 weeks or older: 10 to 15 mg/kg ORALLY once daily or in 2 divided doses with food; discontinue if liver function does not improve within 3 months or if complete biliary obstruction occurs

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono:
• Persistent, worsening liver function or cholestasis: Discontinue use; consider reinitiating at lower dose when liver function returns to baseline.
  • Familial hypertriglyceridemia: 11 to 17 mg/kg orally once daily or in 2 divided doses

sub.title: Indications
sub.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Bile acid synthesis defect, Due to single enzyme defects
  • Disorder of peroxisomal function, With liver disease manifestations, steatorrhea, or complications due to decreased absorption of fat soluble vitamins

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: Specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Cardiovascular:
  • -- Newly diagnosed or family history of familial hypertriglyceridemia may cause poor cholic acid absorption; dose adjustment recommended
  • Hepatic:
  • -- Exacerbation of liver impairment (eg, elevated bilirubin values, worsening of serum transaminases or cholestasis) has been reported; monitoring recommended and discontinuation may be necessary
  • -- Concurrent elevations of serum gamma glutamyltransferase (GGT) and ALT may indicate overdose
  • Concomitant Use:
  • -- Avoid concomitant cyclosporine use

sub.title: Pregnancy Category
sub.mono: Fetal risk cannot be ruled out. (TH)

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

2.mono:

  • Aluminum Hydroxide (probable)

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Dermatologic:Skin lesion (1%)
  • Gastrointestinal:Abdominal pain (1%), Diarrhea (2%), Gastro-esophageal reflux disease with esophagitis (1%), Nausea (1%), Polyp of intestine (1%)
  • Hepatic:Jaundice (1%)
  • Renal:Urinary tract infectious disease (1%)
  • Other:Malaise (1%)
Serious
  • Gastrointestinal:Cholelithiasis
  • Hepatic:Abnormal liver function, Exacerbation
  • Neurologic:Peripheral nerve disease (1%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Cholic acid is a bile acid replacement therapy that corrects deficiencies due to defective biosynthesis or intestinal malabsorption. Cholic acid and its conjugates are ligands of a receptor (farnesoid X receptor, or FXR) which regulates enzymes and transporters that are important in bile acid synthesis and in maintaining bile acid homeostasis in the enterohepatic circulation.

3.title: Excretion
3.mono:
• Bile: Conjugated cholic acid
  • Fecal: Unabsorbed cholic acid

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
  • Administer with food.
  • Do not crush or chew capsules.
  • For patients unable to swallow the capsule, contents may be added to 1 to 2 tablespoons (15 to 30 mL) of infant formula or breast milk (for young children), or soft food such as mashed potatoes or apple puree (for older children); mix for 30 seconds and administer immediately.
  • Administer at least 1 hour before or 4 to 6 hours after an aluminum-based antacid or a bile acid binding resin.

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• Reduction or elimination of bile acid metabolites may indicate efficacy
  • AST, ALT, serum gamma glutamyltransferase, alkaline phosphatase, bilirubin, and INR monthly; for the first 3 months, every 3 months over the next 9 months, every 6 months during the subsequent 3 years, and annually thereafter, with increased monitoring during periods of rapid growth, concomitant disease, and pregnancy

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Tell patient to report symptoms of liver impairment or cholestasis.
  • Side effects may include diarrhea, reflux esophagitis, nausea, abdominal pain, malaise, urinary tract infection, or peripheral neuropathy.
  • Advise patient to take capsule with food.
  • Tell caregiver of pediatric patient that capsule contents can be mixed with a liquid or soft food and must be given immediately after mixing.
  • Direct patient to take drug at least 1 hour before or 4 to 6 hours after a bile acid binding resin or aluminum-based antacid.
